D:/CCC 2.0/AI/AGI/CONTEXT/research/_outp.path: D:/CCC 2.0/AI/AGI/CONTEXT/research/_output/Kimi K2 - The Missing Components for AGI_ASI_ A Technical and Theoretical Analysis_2025-12-23_2025-12-23_2025-12-23.md

sections.anchor: D:/CCC 2.0/AI/AGI/CONTEXT/research/_output/Kimi K2 - The Missing Components for AGI_ASI_ A Technical and Theoretical Analysis_2025-12-23_2025-12-23_2025-12-23.md#root
sections.title: Root
1. The Critical Deficit in Long-Term Memory and Continuity
1.1. The "Memory Extension Problem" as a Core Bottleneck
1.1.1. Quantifying the Gap: Zero Progress in Long-Term Memory Storage
1.1.2. The "Reset" Problem: Lack of Persistent Intelligence Across Interactions
1.1.3. Distinguishing Memory Storage from True Continual Learning
1.2. The Need for a "Cognitive Infrastructure" for Persistence
1.2.1. Pillar 1: Structure for Navigating and Organizing Knowledge
1.2.2. Pillar 2: Memory as a "Return" to Past Understanding
1.2.3. Pillar 3: Evolutionary Interaction for Recursive Learning
1.3.1. How Monolithic Models Erase Prior Knowledge
1.3.2. The Need for Incremental, Non-Destructive Learning
2.1.1. The Limitations of End-to-End Transformer Architectures
2.1.2. The Argument for Modular and Hybrid Systems
2.2. The "Missing Layer": A Coordination Layer for LLMs
2.2.1. LLMs as a "Substrate" for Pattern Storage (System 1)
2.2.2. The Need for a System 2-like Coordination Layer
2.2.3. Implementing Semantic Anchoring and Transactional Memory
2.3.1. The HOPE Architecture: Separating Fast and Slow Learning
2.3.2. Slow Memory for Stable, Long-Term Knowledge
2.3.3. Fast Reasoning for Immediate Context and Adaptation
2.4.1. Integrating Mechanisms like Synaptic Pruning and Hebbian Plasticity
2.4.2. Dual Memory Systems for Efficient Continual Learning
3. The Role of Symbolic Representation and Compression
3.1. Limitations of Natural Language for AGI Communication
3.1.2. High Token Overhead and Interpretive Drift
3.2. Symbolic Compression for Efficiency and Reflection
